component.name: CrossMacro
component.summary: Mouse and keyboard macro automation tool

description.p: CrossMacro is a powerful mouse and keyboard macro recording and playback tool that works on both Wayland and X11 sessions. It provides a modern, cross-platform solution for automating repetitive tasks.

ul.li: Record and replay mouse movements, clicks, and keyboard events
Text Expansion support for productivity (e.g., :mail â†’ email@example.com)
Assign macros to keyboard shortcuts with toggle or hold-to-run modes
Schedule macros to run at specific times or intervals
Macro editor with undo/redo and action reordering
Playback with pause/resume, adjustable speed (0.1x to 10x), and loop mode
Save and load macros in .macro format
Global hotkeys for control (F8: Record, F9: Play, F10: Pause)
Multiple themes: Classic, Latte, Mocha, Dracula, Nord

description.p: This Flatpak supports both Wayland and X11 sessions. On Wayland, it uses direct input device access for macro functionality. Mouse position tracking works natively on Hyprland (IPC), KDE Plasma (D-Bus), and GNOME (Shell Extension).
On GNOME, a Shell Extension is automatically installed on first run. A logout/login may be required for the extension to take effect.
Wayland requires one of: (1) User in "input" group: sudo usermod -aG input $USER, or (2) CrossMacro daemon service installed from native packages (deb, rpm, AUR).
